hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Cointegration Breakout Pairs Trade
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 20-day rolling z-score of the BTC/ETH price ratio exceeds ±1.5 standard deviations from its 100-day mean, the ratio will revert to the mean within 5 trading days with 70% probability in NEUTRAL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH maintain long-term equilibrium as dominant crypto assets. In neutral regimes without strong directional bias, temporary divergences due to liquidity flows or news events create mean-reversion opportunities. The 20-day z-score captures recent deviations while 100-day mean provides stable equilibrium reference.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH ratio 20-day z-score > +1.5 (short BTC, long ETH)
BTC/ETH ratio 20-day z-score < -1.5 (long BTC, short ETH)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Ratio returns to within ±0.5 z-score of mean

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 60% of trades profitable over 100+ samples, or average holding period exceeding 5 days for profitable closure.
